Name: Schaum's Outline of Physics for Engineering and Science: 788 Solved Problems + 25 Videos (Schaum's Outline Series)

ReviewList.Text: I've only been using this book for a day and have already been plagued by typos and errors. For example: page 57, the books states that 56,000x0.05 is 2300. Anyone who has a calculator can confirm that the correct answer is 2800. There was also a worked out solution on page 55 which misses a variable T in the explanation. I spent a solid amount of time trying to figure out how they solved that problem before I realized it was a typo. It makes for a very frustrating studying experience when you are trying to figure out what your study material did wrong in solving the problem instead of trying to figure out what you did wrong in solving the problem.

I ordered this textbook for my son in Honolulu, since it was highly recommended for his Physics course but was not available at the campus book store or anywhere else locally. This is the exact edition needed, & he says it' been very helpful as an adjunct to his other textbook.

This is good for brushing up on/as a supplement for calculus-based physics.  Yes, there are errors scattered about, but most are overt and therefore readily seen.  I think this has actually helped in the study process, as we should be aware that there are errors in real life.  If the data doesn't seem right (like a nitrogen molecule moving through the air at 500m/s -- huh?) and my answer doesn't jive with the book's answer, but does when the molecule is moving at 0.500m/s(much more reasonable), the obvious data error is confirmed.  Sometimes the book answers are wrong with the given data, but most are apparent and makes for good real-life practice in dealing with errors. I guess the key to really put the book to its best use is to look forward to the errors and fix them.  I tend to think that maybe the errors were put in on purpose to help the student learn more.  At least it has in my case.

We adopted this as a cheap alternative to a text but are having regrets.  The basic content is ok but the typos, particularly in solved problems, are numerous and devastating to learning.  Clearly proof reading by folks with a physics background was minimal
The book is OK for a quick study or a review, but the myriad errors are upsetting.

Helps understand and shows a bunch of worked out problems. has a summary at end of each chapter, it really helped me learn physics, couldn't have excelled in my physics class without it. I RECOMEND this to anyone taking physics and I  encourage teachers to require students to have them use it. This book is great.
Good book. Needed it for physics class. It still has errors but my professor knows that already and fixes them for us.
